instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 not turining on
threads.message:
Good morning this mac suffered oxidation in the region U1950,Q8150 and U8160, I replaced it, but it won't turn on. 


Voltage: 

PPbus 8,59V
PP3v42 3v42
all_SYS 0V, pulses to 3V
PLT_RST 0V.
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3,4
PCH_DSWVRMEN 3,24V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3,4V
PM_BATLOW_L 3,3V
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX 0,428V
V PCH_INTRUDER_L 3.065V
V_SRST_L 3,3V
PCH_INTVRMEN 3.24
RTC_RESET_L 3.33V

threads.title: 820-00165 not turining on
threads.message:
What about pins 7 & 3 of U1950?
Check for pulse at least.

Q8150 is redundant protection, not really needed.
Many times I just remove it from the board...

threads.title: 820-00165 not turining on
threads.message:
Keep in mind, your borad tries to turn on, as you get pulsing voltages.
Not booting is what we need to find why.

Do you get pulse on all big coils, including PCH and CPU?

threads.title: 820-00165 not turining on
threads.message:
Any pulse at PLT_RESET_L?
I bet something more affected for corrosion.

Did you try SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-00165 not turining on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 77957, member: 682"]
Any pulse at PLT_RESET_L?
[/QUOTE]
PLT_RESET_L 0v, pulses 2.5V;

When you trigger the SMC bypass the cooler turns and stops.

threads.title: 820-00165 not turining on
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
I recommend to reball SMC.
There may also be accumulated crap underneath CPU; you should heat it with quality flux.

Sometime, BIOS corruption can occur on corroded boards.
